Issues.Title: SubForm Field Validators, but Parent has no Validator
Issues.Body:
Hello,

i'm currently a little bit unsure what is going on.
I have made a reusable Reactive SubForm Component let's call it Adress.
It has Validators on it, so that the required fields for an Adress are there.
However when i use this subForm in a parent form, and i set no Validator.required on the adress field of the parent Form the subForm is still invalid and so the parentForm, although on the parentForm i have no validators.

I think something is not running correct here, because when i say on the parent i don't want validator on the adress field, the subForm should ignore it's validators, or at least set itself to valid.

I think it would be bad programming if the subForm has to listen for the required Validator on the parent and then set the field to be required or not...

Also i don't know how to listen if the parentForm has a Validator on this field or not.

Please give me any hints into the right direction,

Thanks,
Nick
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "SubForm Field Validators, but Parent has no Validator" (#42051)

Issues.Title: Can't run api-extractor on library compiled with ivy
Issues.Body:
# Bug Report

### Affected Package

The issue is caused by package @angular/compiler-cli


### Is this a regression?

No, though I should note this is only an issue with Ivy and not with ViewEngine.

### Description

The `.d.ts` file generated by a partial ivy compilation is not compatible with `@microsoft/api-extractor`, a tool preferred by the APF document

> As of APF v8 we now prefer to run the .d.ts bundler tool from https://api-extractor.com/ so that the entire API appears in a single file.
>
> In prior APF versions each entry point would have a `src` directory next to the .d.ts entry point and this directory contained individual d.ts files matching the structure of the original source code. While this distribution format is still allowed and supported, it is highly discouraged because it confuses tools like IDEs that then offer incorrect autocompletion, and allows users to depend on deep-import paths which are typically not considered to be public API of a library or a package.
>
> ~ https://docs.google.com/document/d/1CZC2rcpxffTDfRDs6p1cfbmKNLA6x5O-NtkJglDaBVs/preview#heading=h.d5w3fovwzg9

While this isn't a bug in an angular package per se, the advise given in the APF document has pushed me towards opening this ticket as bug on the angular/angular repo and not as feature in microsoft/rushstack.

## Minimal Reproduction

```bash
cd $(mktemp -d)
git clone github.com/bgotink/angular-repro-42063 .
yarn
yarn build
```

Disable `enableIvy` in the `tsconfig.json` file and `yarn build` will work.

## Exception or Error

Error while running `api-extractor`:

```
ERROR: "import * as ___ from ___;" is not supported yet for local files.
/private/var/folders/_d/ch2kc4h960d10cy_2c41qqzw0000gn/T/tmp.6Rkk9EFSAa/dist/module.d.ts:3:1
```

The `dist/module.d.ts` file the error points to:

```
import { MyDirective } from './directive';
import * as i0 from "@angular/core";
import * as i1 from "./directive";
export declare class MyModule {
    static ɵfac: i0.ɵɵFactoryDeclaration<MyModule, never>;
    static ɵmod: i0.ɵɵNgModuleDeclaration<MyModule, [typeof i1.MyDirective], never, [typeof i1.MyDirective]>;
    static ɵinj: i0.ɵɵInjectorDeclaration<MyModule>;
}
export { MyDirective };
```

## Your Environment

**Angular Version:**

`@angular/*` version 12.0.0-rc.3, `ng-packagr` version 12.0.0-rc.3, `@microsoft/api-extractor` version 7.15.1

**Anything else relevant?**

We don't actually use ng-packagr. Our (private) toolchain yields the exact same output so I used ng-pacakgr for the reproduction.
We follow the APF document's preference and run `@microsoft/api-extractor` to roll up the `.d.ts` files.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Can't run api-extractor on library compiled with ivy" (#42064)

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler): support interpolation tokens when lexing markup
Issues.Body:
The lexer now splits interpolation tokens out from text tokens.
Previously the contents of `<div>Hello, {{ name}}<div>` would be a single
text token. Now it will be three tokens:

```
TEXT: "Hello, "
INTERPOLATION: "{{", " name", "}}"
TEXT: ""
```

- INTERPOLATION tokens have three parts, "start marker", "expression"
  and "end marker".
- INTERPOLATION tokens are always preceded and followed by TEXT tokens,
  even if they represent an empty string.

The HTML parser has been modified to recombined these tokens to allow this
refactoring to have limited effect in this commit. Further refactorings
to use these new tokens will follow in subsequent commits.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(compiler): support interpolation tokens when lexing markup" (#42062)

Issues.Title: Support for AngularJS aHrefSanitizationTrustedUrlList feature
Issues.Body: I can't find a way to port the feature we have in our AngularJS to our Angular app: https://docs.angularjs.org/api/ng/provider/$compileProvider#aHrefSanitizationTrustedUrlList If i google around they all say use the https://angular.io/api/platform-browser/DomSanitizer but thats not the same, As far as i can see that only tells us that we want to trust more (possible unsafe stuff) But we want the other way around we want to be more stricter if sanitize happens.. If we have a following html template: ` helloMy Nice Linkplease click ` And i place that on an Angular component that displays that html Then i want that angular makes it: ` helloMy Nice Linkplease click ` or something like that, in AngularJS it just fully removes the href attribute if i i set an allowed/trusted url list. (which doesnt include evil.com) But no matter where i look that just isn't possible right now? it seems only if i do: ` helloMy Nice Linkplease click ` angular makes it ` helloMy Nice Linkplease click ` I would love to have a hook that after the current Angular implementation says i don't do anything with that url that i can still say no this is also unsafe.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Support for AngularJS aHrefSanitizationTrustedUrlList feature " (#42061)

Issues.Title: Support @Input() default values
Issues.Body:
# Feature Request

### Relevant Package
Main component API, Input on Angular/Core


### Description
It would be very helpful to support @Input() default values. There are very complicated and unnatural workarounds for this but it would be a lot better if this is just a simple native feature.


### Describe the solution you'd like
@Input() myValue: string = 'abcd'
If there's an input value this value gets an override, else the component works with the default value.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
There are complex implementations for this using NgOnChanges. For someone who is constantly working on design systems, this is very innefficient
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support @Input() default values" (#42048)

Issues.Title: Support event forwarding
Issues.Body:
# Feature Request

### Relevant Package
Angular/Core component API


### Description
Please add support to event forwarding (similar to Svelte). This feature reduces dramatically overcomplicated workarounds and endless @Output() configuration when working with nested components. Sometimes you just want to be able to easily pass forward the event to the parent. This would add much-needed simplicity to this aspect of the framework.
 
### Describe the solution you'd like
Just an idea: 
<app-my-component (myClick)></app-my-component> // This forwards the 'click' event to the parent component.
<app-parent-component (myClick)="eventHandler($event)"></app-parent-component> // the parent component works with the forwarded event and its respective data.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Would it be also very useful to be able to forward native events like 'click', 'change', 'input'.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support event forwarding" (#42049)

Issues.Title: View updates correctly if parent sends Input to child OnInit and child emits Output. Parent view does not update correctly if child passes those values to another child and back. Expression Changed.
Issues.Body:
# Bug Report ### Description I'm see the view update correctly in a parent component when it passes data back and forth using a single child component. However, I'm getting ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError if the parent component passes data to a component which passes the data to another component before passing it back through to the parent. **This works:** 1. A root component sets loading OnInit 2. The root component uses OnInit to send a value to a child component after a delay (simulated api call) 2. OnChanges in the child, it uses an Output to emit a value back to the parent 3. The parent updates the the value of loading based on the output 4. The view in the parent is updated correctly **This does not** 1. A root component sets loading OnInit 2. The root component uses OnInit to send a value to a passthrough component after a delay (simulated api call) 3. The passthrough sends the value to the child component via an Input 4. OnChanges in the child, it uses an Output to emit a value back to the passthrough 5. The passthrough uses an Output to emit the value back to the parent 6. The parent updates the the value of loading based on the output 7. The view in the parent is not updated correct and ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError occurs Why doesn't the output event emitter in the 2nd case cause the parent view to be checked? This type of behavior would be useful to be because I want to have detachable form pieces that are fed data from a parent via Inputs and can notify the parent of a change so the parent can act on that change. It would be great if those form pieces would work a few levels removed from the parent instead of just one. ## Minimal Reproduction **Basic issue:** https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-11-expression-changed?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts **Example with forms:** https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-11-split-form You can see the Expression Changed error go away and the view update correctly if you comment out the passthrough and uncomment the child in app.component.html ## Exception or Error 

preview-2bfbc3e0fe63b64e42deb.js:1 ERROR Error: ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError: Expression has changed after it was checked. Previous value: 'ngIf: false'. Current value: 'ngIf: true'.
    at viewDebugError (errors.ts:38)
    at expressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError (errors.ts:24)
    at checkBindingNoChanges (util.ts:103)
    at checkNoChangesNodeInline (view.ts:486)
    at checkNoChangesNode (view.ts:474)
    at debugCheckNoChangesNode (services.ts:471)
    at debugCheckDirectivesFn (services.ts:398)
    at Object.eval [as updateDirectives] (AppComponent.html:16)
    at Object.debugUpdateDirectives [as updateDirectives] (services.ts:390)
    at checkNoChangesView (view.ts:354)
## Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

11.2.13
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "View updates correctly if parent sends Input to child OnInit and child emits Output. Parent view does not update correctly if child passes those values to another child and back. Expression Changed." (#42047)

Issues.Title: Directive on ng-container: inconsistent behavior when accessing 'el.nativeElement.nodeValue'
Issues.Body:
# Bug Report ### Description I'm trying to determine whether a (attribute-)directive was applied to a ng-container element. I let angular inject the directives ElementRef and access 'nativeElement.nodeValue' for this. When running a development build (e.g. with ng serve) this returns 'ng-container' as expected. On a production build, an empty string is returned. **Directive:** ``` @Directive({ selector: '[my-directive]' }) export class MyDirectiveDirective { constructor(private el: ElementRef) { const nodeValue = this.el.nativeElement.nodeValue; console.log(nodeValue); } } ``` **Usage:** ``` ``` ## Minimal Reproduction Repo: https://github.com/koglerch13/angular-ngcontainer-nodevalue 1. Start the application with 'ng serve' 2. open the DevTools/Console 3. Observe the output (should appear similar the following screenshot) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15924552/117821256-ae460000-b26b-11eb-8733-8c332ed1b4ea.png) 4. Stop the dev server 5. Re-run the application with 'ng serve --prod' 6. Observe the console output again (see the following screenshot) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15924552/117821548-fe24c700-b26b-11eb-82f6-4900f3eeeba9.png) **Expected result:** both outputs are the same **Actual result:** Outputs differ (see screenshots) ## Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 11.2.12
Node: 14.16.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 11.2.13
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1102.12
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1102.12
@angular-devkit/core            11.2.12
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.2.12
@angular/cli                    11.2.12
@schematics/angular             11.2.12
@schematics/update              0.1102.12
rxjs                            6.6.7
typescript                      4.1.5

Issues.Title: build(docs-infra): show a dist-tag when installing the CLI on non-stable versions (BACKPORT: 9.1.x)
Issues.Body:
It is important to use the correct major version of the Angular CLI when
following the examples in the tutorials. This commit provides a custom
element that renders an appropriate dist-tag in the setup step of
the tutorial when the docs are not in "stable" mode.

Fixes #39821

##### BREAKING CHANGES

-   Minified UMD bundles are no longer included in the distributed NPM packages.
-   **animations:** DOM elements are now correctly removed when the root view is removed.
    If you are using SSR and use the app's HTML for rendering, you will need
    to ensure that you save the HTML to a variable before destorying the
    app.
    It is also possible that tests could be accidentally relying on the old behavior by
    trying to find an element that was not removed in a previous test. If
    this is the case, the failing tests should be updated to ensure they
    have proper setup code which initializes elements they rely on.
-   **common:** Methods of the `PlatformLocation` class, namely `onPopState` and `onHashChange`,
    used to return `void`. Now those methods return functions that can be called
    to remove event handlers.
-   **common:** The methods of the `HttpParams` class now accept `string | number | boolean`
    instead of `string` for the value of a parameter.
    If you extended this class in your application,
    you'll have to update the signatures of your methods to reflect these changes.
-   **compiler-cli:** Linked libraries no longer generate legacy i18n message ids. Any downstream
    application that provides translations for these messages, will need to
    migrate their message ids using the `localize-migrate` command line tool.
-   **core:** Angular no longer maintains support for node v10
-   **core:** Previously the `ng.getDirectives` function threw an error in case a
    given DOM node had no Angular context associated with it (for example
    if a function was called for a DOM element outside of an Angular app).
    This behavior was inconsistent with other debugging utilities under `ng`
    namespace, which handled this situation without raising an exception.
    Now calling the `ng.getDirectives` function for such DOM nodes would
    result in an empty array returned from that function.
-   **core:** Switching default of `emitDistinctChangesOnlyDefaultValue`
    which changes the default behavior and may cause some applications which
    rely on the incorrect behavior to fail.

`emitDistinctChangesOnly` flag has also been deprecated and will be
removed in a future major release.

The previous implementation would fire changes `QueryList.changes.subscribe`
whenever the `QueryList` was recomputed. This resulted in an artificially
high number of change notifications, as it is possible that recomputing
`QueryList` results in the same list. When the `QueryList` gets recomputed
is an implementation detail, and it should not be the thing that determines
how often change event should fire.

Unfortunately, fixing the behavior outright caused too many existing
applications to fail. For this reason, Angular considers this fix a
breaking fix and has introduced a flag in `@ContentChildren` and
`@ViewChildren`, that controls the behavior.

    export class QueryCompWithStrictChangeEmitParent {
      @​ContentChildren('foo', {
        // This option is the new default with this change.
        emitDistinctChangesOnly: true,
      })
      foos!: QueryList<any>;
    }

For backward compatibility before v12
`emitDistinctChangesOnlyDefaultValue` was set to `false`. This change
changes the default to `true`.

-   **core:** The type of the `APP_INITIALIZER` token has been changed to more accurately
    reflect the types of return values that are handled by Angular. Previously,
    each initializer callback was typed to return `any`, this is now
    `Promise<unknown> | Observable<unknown> | void`. In the unlikely event that
    your application uses the `Injector.get` or `TestBed.inject` API to inject
    the `APP_INITIALIZER` token, you may need to update the code to account for
    the stricter type.

Additionally, TypeScript may report the TS2742 error if the `APP_INITIALIZER`
token is used in an expression of which its inferred type has to be emitted
into a .d.ts file. To workaround this, an explicit type annotation is needed,
which would typically be `Provider` or `Provider[]`.

-   **core:** Minimum supported `zone.js` version is `0.11.4`
-   **forms:** The `emitEvent` option was added to the following `FormArray` and `FormGroup` methods:

-   FormGroup.addControl
-   FormGroup.removeControl
-   FormGroup.setControl
-   FormArray.push
-   FormArray.insert
-   FormArray.removeAt
-   FormArray.setControl
-   FormArray.clear

If your app has custom classes that extend `FormArray` or `FormGroup` classes and override the
above-mentioned methods, you may need to update your implementation to take the new options into
account and make sure that overrides are compatible from a types perspective.

-   **forms:** Previously `min` and `max` attributes defined on the `<input type="number">`
    were ignored by Forms module. Now presence of these attributes would
    trigger min/max validation logic (in case `formControl`, `formControlName`
    or `ngModel` directives are also present on a given input) and
    corresponding form control status would reflect that.
-   **platform-browser:** `XhrFactory` has been moved from `@angular/common/http` to `@angular/common`.

**Before**

```ts
import {XhrFactory} from '@​angular/common/http';
```

**After**

```ts
import {XhrFactory} from '@​angular/common';
```

-   **router:** Strict null checks will report on fragment potentially being null.
    Migration path: add null check.
-   **router:** The type of the `RouterLinkActive.routerLinkActiveOptions` input was
    expanded to allow more fine-tuned control. Code that previously read
    this property may need to be updated to account for the new type.

### [`v12.0.0`](https://togithub.com/angular/components/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​1200-azurite-insight-2021-05-12)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/angular/components/compare/11.2.12...12.0.0)

#### Highlights

Sass theming API has been reworked so that clients can take advantage of `@use`. This includes:

-   A single entry point into `@angular/material` and `@angular/cdk`
-   Renamed functions, mixins, and variables to be a better reflection of what they do
-   Applications still using `node-sass` will need to switch to the `sass` package

For more information, check out the [new theming guide](https://togithub.com/angular/components/blob/master/guides/theming.md).

##### cdk

_Breaking changes:_

-   **accordion:** The `disabled` and `expanded` properties in the `AccordionItem` are now strict to `boolean`.

Issues.Title: Issue running extract-i18n against a component with inline styles
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [x] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, in v12 from v11 ### Description When running extract-i18n on a component with inline styles there is a message about missing webpack loaders like the following: ```angular-resource://:2:4 - Error: Module parse failed: Unexpected token (2:4) You may need an appropriate loader to handle this file type, currently no loaders are configured to process this file. See https://webpack.js.org/concepts#loaders | > :host { | display: block; | height: 0; ``` ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction 1. Create a new app `ng new repro-app` 2. Edit app.component.ts ```diff diff --git a/src/app/app.component.ts b/src/app/app.component.ts index 6d0fe10..43db9cf 100644 --- a/src/app/app.component.ts +++ b/src/app/app.component.ts @@ -3,7 +3,7 @@ import { Component } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: 'app-root', templateUrl: './app.component.html', - styleUrls: ['./app.component.css'] + styles: [':host { display: block; height: 0; }'] }) export class AppComponent { title = 'repro-app'; ``` 3. Install `npm install @angular/localize` 4. Run `npm run ng extract-i18n` ## 🔥 Exception or Error ```angular-resource://:2:4 - Error: Module parse failed: Unexpected token (2:4) You may need an appropriate loader to handle this file type, currently no loaders are configured to process this file. See https://webpack.js.org/concepts#loaders | > :host { | display: block; | height: 0; ``` ## 🌍 Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 12.0.0
Node: 14.16.1
Package Manager: npm 6.14.12
OS: linux x64

Angular: 12.0.0
... animations, cdk, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... forms, google-maps, language-service, localize, material
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1200.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular   12.0.0
@angular-devkit/core            12.0.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      12.0.0
@schematics/angular             12.0.0
rxjs                            6.6.7
typescript                      4.2.4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Issue running extract-i18n against a component with inline styles" (#20750)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): fix error with inline styles when running extract-i18n
Issues.Body:
fixes: #20750

When extracting inline styles in Angular 12 there seems to be no CSS loader specified and there will be something like the following message:

```
angular-resource://:2:4 - Error: Module parse failed: Unexpected token (2:4)
You may need an appropriate loader to handle this file type, currently no loaders are configured to process this file. See https://webpack.js.org/concepts#loaders
| 
>     :host {
|       display: block;
|       height: 0;
```

This change adds the mime type to the `angular-resource://` url in order to allow extract-i18n to provide a `webpack.NormalModuleReplacementPlugin` regex for the style URLs to handle them as the non inline styles are handled.

Issues.Title: @angular-devkit/build-angular ~0.901.13 ReDoS issue with PostCSS
Issues.Body:
Hi. Has been some days since our CI pipelines are accusing a dependency vulnerability in PostCSS version used by @angular-devkit/build-angular. This is the CI message output

`Title: Vulnerable Dependency: postcss >=7.0.0 <8.2.10 (Regular Expression Denial of Service)`

We're using Angular 9.1.13 in out application. And other teams reported that they had the same issue, but with @angular-devkit/build-ng-packagr.

This is my `npm audit` output

```
# npm audit report

postcss  7.0.0 - 8.2.9
Severity: moderate
Regular Expression Denial of Service - https://npmjs.com/advisories/1693
fix available via `npm audit fix --force`
Will install @angular-devkit/build-angular@0.1102.12, which is a breaking change
node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/node_modules/postcss
node_modules/autoprefixer/node_modules/postcss
node_modules/css-declaration-sorter/node_modules/postcss
node_modules/css-loader/node_modules/postcss
node_modules/cssnano-preset-default/node_modules/postcss
node_modules/cssnano-util-raw-cache/node_modules/postcss
node_modules/cssnano/node_modules/postcss
node_modules/icss-utils/node_modules/postcss
node_modules/postcss-calc/node_modules/postcss
node_modules/postcss-colormin/node_modules/postcss
```

Issues.Title: Error in new project
Issues.Body:
**I have the following problem when creating a new project**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35763536/118004275-b19ac380-b31f-11eb-9ebe-a894d51af5e1.png)

**My config**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35763536/118004313-ba8b9500-b31f-11eb-9dfb-c81d8952e7ac.png)

Am I doing something wrong?
Versions <= 10 working perfectly.

I already deleted the node_modules folder and then npm install and it didn't work for me.
I also tried ng serve --prod, but to no avail.

For the time being, we keep Angular CLI issues in a separate repository.

We are using AngularCLI on MS Visual Studio Code for devops but as per our security policy users should not have Admin rights on the VDI/workstation. Without admin rights users are not able to install the extension of angluarCLI.  Would like to know how we can allow AngularCLI without Admin rights to Users to use it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angluar CLI  installation on Visual Studio Code require Admin Rights" (#20743)

Issues.Title: Tree shaking problem when accessing nested structure
Issues.Body:
# Bug Report ### Description There is some tree shaking problems when accessing non primitive structure on the same const which was used for conditional imports. Short example: **environment.ts**: ``` export const environment = { production: true, includeModule: false, nestedObject: { childProperty: 'just testing', }, }; ``` **`TestModule` is still included** ``` imports: [BrowserModule, environment.includeModule ? TestModule : []], providers: [ { provide: new InjectionToken('Test'), useValue: environment.nestedObject }, ], ``` **`TestModule` is NOT included** ``` imports: [BrowserModule, environment.includeModule ? TestModule : []], providers: [ { provide: new InjectionToken('Test'), useValue: { childProperty: environment.nestedObject.childProperty, }, }, ], ``` The only difference is that we're accessing non-primitive parameter from `environment` const. My guess is the webpack is somehow confused about the variable then and cannot be sure `environment.includeModule` is false thus ends up including module in the bundle. ## Minimal Reproduction [Reproduction repo](https://github.com/spwin/angular-tree-shaking-issue-1) To reproduce just run: `yarn && npm run build && npm run analyse` to confirm the main bundle is 300+KB Then modify `AppModule` to use only access primitive parameters on `environment` const, like in example above or in repo description. Run `npm run build && npm run analyse` to confirm main bundle size ia 100 KB now ## Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / △ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/
    

Angular CLI: 11.2.3
Node: 14.15.5
OS: linux x64

Angular: 11.2.4
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1102.3
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1102.3
@angular-devkit/core            11.2.3
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.2.3
@angular/cli                    11.2.3
@schematics/angular             11.2.3
@schematics/update              0.1102.3
rxjs                            6.6.6
typescript                      4.0.7
**Anything else relevant?** The issue is happening when using any non-primitive type of the variable like object, array etc.. It's not the first time I occurred the weird tree shaking issues, mostly caused by side effects (https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/41145) and these things are very difficult to identify and isolate. I was wondering if there are any lint rules you would recommend to prevent tree shaking issues or some conventions so we can use them to build some rules? Similar with the environment file, are there any conventions to keep the flat primitives only structure of the object? I'm trying to identify side effects by using experimental webpack 5 as then in `stats.json` there are side effects identified but it's pain to go through them and try to trace backwards if that causes some tree shaking issues and if some bits being included in the main bundle. From `stats.json` I noticed the most side effects are caused because of `ExportedVariableDeclaration` in the top level of the file (enums and consts) but what's the correct way to share `enum` or `const` between multiple files and avoid optimisation bailouts? As if you move these to `*.types.ts` then the all `*.types.ts` will be marked as side effects by webpack in stats.json and there will be optimisation bailout for each of them.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Tree shaking problem when accessing nested structure" (#20742)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): execute dart-sass in a worker
Issues.Body:
The dart-sass Sass implementation will now be executed in a separate worker thread. The wrapper worker implementation provides an interface that can be directly used by Webpack's `sass-loader`.
The worker implementation allows dart-sass to be executed in its synchronous mode which can be up to two times faster than its asynchronous mode. The worker thread also allows Webpack to continue other bundling tasks while the Sass stylesheets are being processed.
Initial testing indicated a ~14% build time improvement for AIO.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): execute dart-sass in a worker" (#20740)

Issues.Body: With this change we disallow add additional properties to the `target` object.

Issues.Title: Unset config
Issues.Body:
**fix(@angular/cli): allow config object to be of JSON.**

With this change we allow unset a config value to be a JSON.
    
Example, `ng config -g schematics {}` will remove the entire `schematics` section from the configuration.


**fix(@angular/cli): allow unsetting config when value is `undefined`**
    
With this change we allow unset a config value when the provided value is `undefined`.
    
Example, `ng config -g schematics undefined` will remove the entire `schematics` section from the configuration.


Closes #20718
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Unset config" (#20727)

Issues.Title: [11.2.x] fix(@schematics/angular): pin `karma-jasmine-html-reporter` to patches in new projects
Issues.Body:
Synchronizes the version pinning strategy with the other karma and jasmine project dependencies.
Allows project's created with npm 7+ to successfully install. `karma-jasmine-html-reporter@1.6` requires dependency versions not present in a new 11.2.x project.

Fixes #20719
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[11.2.x] fix(@schematics/angular): pin `karma-jasmine-html-reporter` to patches in new projects" (#20720)

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>bholloway/resolve-url-loader</summary>

### [`v4.0.0`](https://togithub.com/bholloway/resolve-url-loader/releases/4.0.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/bholloway/resolve-url-loader/compare/3.1.3...4.0.0)

**Features**

-   Better resolution of the original source location - You can more successfully use `url()` in variables and mixins.
-   Dependencies now accept a wider range and explicit dependency on `rework` and `rework-visit` has been removed.

**Breaking Changes**

-   The `engine` option is deprecated which means the old `rework` engine is deprecated.
-   The `keepQuery` behaviour is now the default, the `keepQuery` option has been removed.
-   The `removeCR` option defaults to `true` when executing on Windows OS.
-   The `absolute` option has been removed.
-   The `join` option has changed.

**Migrating**

See the [changlog](https://togithub.com/bholloway/resolve-url-loader/blob/v4-maintenance/packages/resolve-url-loader/CHANGELOG.md).

</details>

Issues.Title: Expose Webpack Configuration
Issues.Body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->

# 🚀 Feature request

### Description

In order to integrate Angular with some external tooling like [Cypress Component Testing](https://docs.cypress.io/guides/component-testing/introduction), it is necessary to provide a webpack (or any other building tool) configuration. 
While `AngularCompilerPlugin` is a really good start, it doesn't cover the whole magic happening under the hood of `@angular-devkit/build-angular`. This needs us to create a custom webpack config using the `AngularCompilerPlugin`.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Even though Webpack is kind of an Angular implementation detail, it would be a dream come true to expose a function like `ɵresolveWebpackConfig({target: 'my-app'})` that could be inspired from:
https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/f6135a20d1f3fd8afe85ba10906afb1fb7e91dea/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/dev-server/index.ts#L99-L104

I understand that this would considerably extend the public API's surface and that is why I am totally alright if we could start some experiments with a non-public function (hence the `ɵ`).
https://github.com/jscutlery/test-utils/blob/ec422695e9de3ecfa560143098bda6198756e860/packages/cypress-mount-integration/src/plugins/index.js#L6-L40

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Creating a public library exposing a webpack config that mimics `@angular-devkit/build-angular` behavior.

If you are OK with the idea, I'd be happy to help.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Expose Webpack Configuration" (#20731)

Issues.Title: Support more meaningful options for dialog `autoFocus`
Issues.Body:
Currently, the `autoFocus` option of `MatDialogConfig` is a boolean, with the values meaning:
* `false` - default value, focused the `role="dialog`" element
* `true` - focuses the first tabbable element inside the dialog

This API is kind of confusing, since the dialog automatically focuses _something_ regardless of what you do, so `autoFocus: false` doesn't really make sense. 

Instead, we should change `autoFocus` to accept these values:
* `dialog` - focus the `role="dialog"` element
* `first-tabbable` - focus the first tabbable element
* `first-header` - focus the first header (h1 - h6) element in the dialog. It's still an open question whether this should force `tabIndex = -1`.
* A CSS selector- arbitrary CSS selector, the dialog would focus the first matching element (vis `querySelector`). Again an open question if this should force `tabIndex = -1`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Support more meaningful options for dialog `autoFocus`" (#22678)

Issues.Title: feat(MatTooltip): HTML support, at last?
Issues.Body: #### Feature Description It can be found in any of: - https://github.com/angular/components/issues/19367 - https://github.com/angular/components/issues/17082 - https://github.com/angular/components/issues/6515 - https://github.com/angular/components/issues/5672 - https://github.com/angular/components/issues/5440 - https://github.com/angular/components/issues/3676 - https://github.com/angular/components/issues/3566 #### Use Case An image is worth more than a thousand words... (Notice the bold text and the different colors used. In case it wasn't clear, this is from Google Chrome.) Honestly, the reasons given so far for not supporting HTML in tooltips just don't seem to be strong enough. It's fine that a guideline recommends not to abuse this feature, but enforcing it for everybody all the time is too restrictive. It sounds a bit pitiful when put into words, but please allow us to use HTML in the web... The other main argument seems to be that this affects accessibility, but this believe hasn't been well explained. If having plain text inside a tooltip is not seen as a problem, I don't see how having a `` tag can be.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "feat(MatTooltip): HTML support, at last?" (#22672)

Issues.Title: bug(SelectionList): Focus order for multi-select list is not set correctly
Issues.Body:
From [WAI ARIA practices 3.14](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices/#listbox_kbd_interaction):

> If none of the options are selected before the listbox receives focus, focus is set on the first option and there is no automatic change in the selection state.
If one or more options are selected before the listbox receives focus, focus is set on the first option in the list that is selected.

The current behavior seems that it always focus on the first item in the list. And after modifying the selection, it always focus on the last focused option.

#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: 
- https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-789euh?file=src/app/list-selection-example.html

Steps to reproduce:
Scenario1: In the first list, select "Clogs" and then "Loafers". Then use tab to navigate to the first list.
Scenario2: Use tab to navigate to second list.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior
Scenario1: When navigate to the first list, it should automatically focus on "Clogs" option.
Scenario2: When navigate to the second list, it should automatically focus on "Second" option.


#### Actual Behavior
Scenario1: When navigate to the first list, it focuses on the "Loafers" option.
Scenario2: When navigate to the second list, it focuses on the "First" option.


#### Environment

- CDK/Material: 11.2.12
- Browser(s): Chrome, Firefox
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(SelectionList): Focus order for multi-select list is not set correctly" (#22675)

Issues.Title: fix(material/table): Make table data source interface generic
Issues.Body:
Modify the `MatTableDataSource` interface so that instead of expecting either the legacy `MatPaginator` or MDC-based `MatPaginator`, it accepts something with the right API interface and defaults to that.

This change enables users to migrate from the legacy table to the MDC-based table without requiring them to also migrate the pagintor (which then also includes select, thus all form field elements, and button and tooltip).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/table): Make table data source interface generic" (#22673)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-progress-spinner): set line-height
Issues.Body:
When the line-height is much larger than the diameter, the spinner breaks. 

Example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-rgtfre-k7iryu?file=src/app/progress-spinner-overview-example.html

This explicitly sets it to 0 rather than whatever it would inherit.

Filed an issue with MDC: https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/issues/7118
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material-experimental/mdc-progress-spinner): set line-height" (#22668)

Issues.Title: feat(COMPONENT): Improve CdkTable keyboard accessibility when combined with MatSort
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description
A way to easily access MatSort within the template when used in conjunction with cdk-header-cell 

#### Use Case
Improve the implementation of CdkTable navigation for users.

### Additional Detail
When using MatSort, an accessible sort header can be conveniently added to CdkTable. However, when implementing arrowkey accessibility per [W3's datatable example](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices/examples/grid/dataGrids.html#),  it is hard to listen to keydown events from the sort header within the table template. It would be nice to have an easier way to control keydown events on the sort headers.

Also, this is my first feature request, so sorry in advance if I did something wrong!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(COMPONENT): Improve CdkTable keyboard accessibility when combined with MatSort" (#22667)

Issues.Title: fix(material/datepicker): pass correct inject flags to injector
Issues.Body:
We have a call to `Injector.get` in the date range input which is supposed to fall back to `null` if the value doesn't resolve, however we're missing the `Optional` flag. It works by accident at the moment, because the inject flags aren't actually being passed through by the framework.

https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/41592 is supposed to fix the framework issue, but their CI will break due to our usage.

These changes fix our usage in order to unblock the framework PR.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/datepicker): pass correct inject flags to injector" (#22665)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-datepicker): Datepicker input doesn't clear on invalid value
Issues.Body:
When I enter invalid text in the date input, the control value goes null but the datepicker input is not cleared of the invalid value.

#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: 
- Components: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-z7nui6?file=src%2Fapp%2Fdatepicker-overview-example.ts

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the above stackblitz link
2. In the date field, input an invalid value like "31-31-2001" and tab out
3. The formcontrol goes to an invalid state, the value becomes null but the input still shows the invalid value
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

On entering an invalid value, the input should be cleared as the control value is null.


#### Actual Behavior

The control value is null, but the invalid value is still shown on the screen


#### Environment

- Angular: 11.2.13
- CDK/Material: 11.2.12
- Browser(s): Edge, Chrome, Firefox
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-datepicker): Datepicker input doesn't clear on invalid value" (#22663)
